CatDescriptText: Mrs. Viola Woods, housewife, Penn Hills, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 23, 1961, pg. 7, with question: "Do you think race relations are improving or worsening in Pittsburgh?"  Answer reads: "In a way, things are improving, but we have a long distance to go. One area, in which they are improving, is employment.  The issue is being raised in department stores, and most are beginning to employ fairly..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Viola Woods wearing light colored coat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
